headline: Hangover Helper: Chef Diane Hendriks with food to cure your hangover
subHeadline: Chef Diane Hendriks joins us to talk about the best foods and beverages to beat a hangover.

utterances.speaker: Bacon Bloody Mary
utterances.utterance: This classic tomato juice concoction is typically heralded as the perfect hangover cure due to the combination of nutrients from each ingredient. Take it to another level by adding bacon which replenishes amino acids and replaces sodium.

utterances.speaker: Fernet-Branca
utterances.utterance: An Italian spirit said to have medical properties and does a great job of settling the stomach, which is why it’s referred to as digestives.

utterances.speaker: Ginger Beer
utterances.utterance: Very intense ginger flavor. Can sip on it all day.

utterances.speaker: Water
utterances.utterance: Alcohol is a diuretic which leads to increased water loss. Use water to rehydrate.

utterances.speaker: Coconut water
utterances.utterance: Coconut water contains lots of electrolytes including sodium and more potassium than traditional sports drinks. It is great for rehydration.

utterances.speaker: Pickle juice
utterances.utterance: Quick electrolyte replenish-er. Staple for hangovers in Poland and they drink a lot of vodka – vinegar, salt and water (2 shots).

utterances.speaker: Coffee
utterances.utterance: Improve your hangover fatigue and become more alert, coffee is not a bad choice. FOODS

utterances.speaker: Protein rich foods
utterances.utterance: Alcohol is taking your amino acids to detox the liver so you need to replenish by way of protein like eggs, meat, fish, cottage cheese, sunflower butter, beans.

utterances.speaker: Carbs
utterances.utterance: Whole grains, oats, beans, multigrain bread, crackers - fast and slow-acting carbs that can increase your blood sugar during a hangover and improve related symptoms.

utterances.speaker: Electrolytes
utterances.utterance: Alcohol blocks the production of a hormone that helps your body hold on to water, leading to dehydration and the loss of electrolytes like potassium and sodium.

utterances.speaker: Potassium
utterances.utterance: Sweet potatoes, avocado, salmon, tomatoes, spinach (folate), bananas.

utterances.speaker: Watermelon
utterances.utterance: High water content helps with rehydration.

utterances.speaker: Honey
utterances.utterance: Has a high natural fructose content which may help rid your body of alcohol more quickly and possibly help you feel better after drinking too much.

utterances.speaker: Nuts
utterances.utterance: Drinking too much can deplete magnesium in your cells and nuts can replenish.

utterances.speaker: Blueberries
utterances.utterance: Blueberries are rich in nutrients that fight inflammation in your body. Oranges & Kiwi: Rich in vitamin C, help prevent your body from losing antioxidants that help rid your body of alcohol.

utterances.speaker: Peppermint and Ginger
utterances.utterance: Can help sooth nausea. Try fresh ginger, crystallized ginger and ginger tea.
